title: Help me with a champ plz anyone
body: Who should i get: {{champion:69}}  {{champion:150}} {{champion:121}} {{champion:6}} {{champion:245}}  I play anywhere except Supp

replies.body:
Well you should learn to play sup. No matter what you are going to end up playing sup. Whether in normals because you were beaten in calling a lane or in ranked because you are last pick and no one gives a damn what you call there. 

In my opinion, Gnar is the better pick because of how he can change forms. He can be a slippery bugger when mini or a CC tank when Mega. He fits in a lot of team comps and he is really fun to play.

It's hard to manage that rage though. 
One moment your chasing a low adc with Ghostblade on then bam! Mega Gnar.
That's his counter play though. Once you learn to manage that then you are one of the best top-laners around.
you play anywhere except supp? gtfo toxic 12 year old
I am 13 and  i just mean that. I have never played support before. I am not actually toxic dude. :)

Supporting is fun in a different way to getting kills. 
There are a wide range of supports and like any other lane/role there are odd picks that work. 
{{champion:201}} is a great CC source and an aggressive support. He can take a punishing and block all forms of spells with his naturally tanky stats and his Unbreakable. The point of Braum, the way to succeed and stomp lane is to apply your stacks primarily on ADCs and Mid-carries. The stun will set up a lot other CC abilities. It's one of his strongest capabilities. 
Even though Braum is tanky he can suffer pretty badly from harass during lane phase unless you are god at dodging every ability. 
{{champion:16}} doesn't really have as much reliable CC or tanky base stats but she makes up for it for probably being the best healer in the game. I don't play her much but from what I've experienced she is a great sustainer for harass. If you manage to land her Q on enemy champions consistently she can sustain herself well as well. She can change can make a 1v1 being in which your ally is losing into an easy win for your ally with her ult.

A bitesize guide to support

Ward: Your blu or red, whatever closer
Poke: Poke enemy adc and support like hell

Basically your mindset is to keep your carry alive, help secure kills for your carry, and just generally bitching for your carry

Learn how to play support please. It will do everyone including you a favour. 
It's not that difficult. I say it's easier than jungling. 
Wards are key as support.

If you want overall improvement on your mechanics I would go ekko out of the champs you have given us as an option and here is why:

1) His kit is pretty much everything you need to learn on any champ in League of legends (i.e Q - Point Skillshot, W - Placement Skillshot, E - Dash/Blink)

2) He is extremely broken right now = Get fed and carry.

Hope this helps! If you want to learn more you can follow my stream which I go on every night between 5pm - Late - Aus, Queensland Time. http://www.twitch.tv/Thrill3rrrr
